title: Beta blocker
summary: Beta blockers, also spelled Î²-blockers, are a class of medications that are predominantly used to manage abnormal heart rhythms, and to protect the heart from a second heart attack (myocardial infarction) after a first heart attack (secondary prevention).[1] They are also widely used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), although they are no longer the first choice for initial treatment of most patients.[2]
